PageTitle: peer advertise-community (BGP-IPv6 unicast address family view)
FuncDef:
The peer advertise-community command configures a device to advertise community attributes to its peer.
The undo peer advertise-community command cancels the existing configuration. The peer advertise-community command configures a device to advertise community attributes to its peer. The undo peer advertise-community command cancels the existing configuration. By default, a device does not advertise community attributes to any peer. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: To configure a device to advertise community attributes to a specified peer or peer group, run the peer advertise-community command. If the command is run on the local device for a peer group, all the members in the peer group will inherit the configuration. This simplifies the application of routing policies and facilitates route maintenance and management.
